title: Is it possible that God created the multiverse, and the first races of a universe in that multiverse reached ascension, only to become that first God? - Quora

response.answer_text: That would mean that they had developed time travel because, in your scenario, the universe was created first, then the aliens - but the aliens are the god that created the universe. (BTW, “that first God” is grammatically incorrect, it’s “that first god”. You don’t capitalize the G in god unless it starts a sentence or you’re talking about the god named God - the English name of the Christian god.) Is it possible that they went back in time to create the universe they went back in time from? Sure, but that’s a paradox, and you’d have to solve it first (show, logically, how something impossible can happen - going back in time and killing your father’s father before your father was conceived is another one - you have no father, so you can’t exist - so you can’t kill anyone, so … on and on and …) But there have been science fiction stories (most of them not very good) about things like that.

Yes, I believe consciousness evolves all over the universe - and its purpose is to evolve back to the one consciousness of God. So when a particular race of consciousness reaches a certain level of awareness. It knows how to tap into the multiverse (which is a dreamworld) and can pull in the dominant zeitgeist and possibly ascend to heaven - where that particular species becomes God-like. Then they go help the next species to ascend to heaven. Some don’t make it and become malevolent Gods that counterbalance the benevolent Gods. Try to ruin the next species trying to make it. Here’s where you can bring in Biblical or other holy books prophecies too.
